Online safety: With the rise of social media and online gaming, children are more likely to be exposed to potential online predators and other dangerous situations. Parents and caregivers need to educate their children about online safety and the importance of being cautious when using the internet.

Screen time: The amount of time that children spend in front of screens can have negative effects on their physical and mental health. Parents and caregivers need to set limits on screen time and encourage children to engage in other activities that promote healthy development.

Cyberbullying: Children can be vulnerable to cyberbullying, which can have serious consequences for their mental health. Parents and caregivers need to be aware of the signs of cyberbullying and take steps to address it if it occurs.

Social isolation: Children who spend too much time in front of screens may become socially isolated, which can have negative effects on their emotional and social development. Parents and caregivers need to encourage children to engage in face-to-face social interactions and limit their screen time.

Sleep disturbances: Exposure to screens before bedtime can disrupt sleep patterns and make it difficult for children to fall asleep. Parents and caregivers need to establish a consistent bedtime routine and limit screen time before bed.
